DOC.brief_title: Prognosis Acute Coronary Syndrome HIV-infected Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Background : There many case myocardial infarction report HIV-infected young adult treat HAART . Little known date , concern outcome prognostic factor patient acute coronary syndrome HIV-infection . Methods : Prospective cohort study compare evolution prognosis HIV non-HIV patient ACS . Duration study : Two year include patient . Three year follow-up 100 HIV-patients ACS 200 non-HIV patient ACS include study . All patient include study 30 Intensive Care Unit Cardiology department France . Results : To compare incidence total mortality , cardiovascular mortality ( myocardial infarction , sudden death , cardiogenic shock , fatal stroke ) , morbidity ( non fatal myocardial infarction , unstable angina , recurrence ischemia , cardiac failure , non fatal stroke ) revascularization ( percutaneous coronary intervention , coronary artery bypass graft surgery ) 3-year follow-up HIV non-HIV patient ACS . Univariate multivariate analysis predictive factor cardiovascular event do .
DOC.criteria: Patients > 18 year 's old Man woman HIVinfected HIV 1 without highly active antiretroviral therapy Acute coronary syndrome ( STEMI , NSTEMI unstable angina ) Known atherosclerotic artery disease ( MI , ACS , PCI , CABG , coronary stenosis , stroke , peripheral arteriopathy )
